name: The Jewel Facing Rockefeller Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first time visiting New York and the Jewel was a nice hotel. We were on the 11th floor and had one of only 4 hotel rooms that had a balcony, which was really nice. We stayed Dec 1-6 and overall had a pleasant experience. I was surprised at how small the hotel room was, but that seems to be a standard for New York. The room was very clean and we did have a refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, and iPod charger in the room. With our room facing 51st Street and with a balcony we did hear a lot of noise from the street below, but again, I think that’s going to happen in such a crazy city! We arrived before our 3 PM check in time, and the room wasn’t ready, but they held our bags for us and had them waiting in our room when we came back at 3:00 to check in. The staff was always pleasant. Right out the front door you could see Rockefeller Plaza and the Christmas tree. It was only a 10 minute walk to Times Square, which was one of my favorite places. All in all it was a good experience and I would stay again and recommend to a friend.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: The Jewel has a great location next to Rockefeller Center. The room was OK at best. Not a great layout (for the room), printer did not work in business center so I had difficulty printing out boarding pass, AC/Heat was really a noisy in room individual unit that vs. central air/hat (aka quiet). I had high expectations based on the high rating on Trip Adviisor but it just was not great (or very good).
reviews.title: HIgh Expectations but they were not met

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Jewel Facing Rockefeller Center was great. We stayed in a two bedroom suite and it was really nice. The room was very clean and very quiet for New York hotels. The receptionists were very helpful. They even found us a weighing scale to weigh our luggage when we were leaving. It is in a great location....very central. I give it a 10 out of 10. I will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: What a Jewel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a great few days here. Brilliant location. Rooms big for New York, very clean and loved all the little extra touches such as USB charging ports and iphone alarm clock. Staff were pleasant, very quiet here (considering the sirens are always going in NYC) I'd definately go back. We had an awesome rate, cheapest by far in NYC although that was for opening specials.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Jewel is a jewel of a hotel located just a half a block off Rockefeller Plaza and half way between Fifth and Sixth Avenues--one block from Saks Fifth Avenue--half a block from Radio City Music Hall and a short walk to Broadway. It is a a small boutique hotel---recently updated throughout. It is modern, no frills, but has everything you need. Small lobby with a receptionist who does a quick computer check-in. The rooms are small (hey it IS New York!), but well appointed and efficient. Chilled water and plastic bottles to fill free on each floor and free coffee for your room's coffee maker. Small workout room. We had a room on the street side which was suprisiingly quiet for being in the middle of the city. If you need an expansive lobby, concierge, and state of the art fitness center this is not for you. If you want a sleek new conveniently located hotel at a reasonable price (most comparable hotels were $75-100/night more) in Midtown Manhattan this will serve you very well.
reviews.title: Absolute best location in Midtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at The Jewel Hotel facing Rockefeller Center and it was a "Jewel"!!! Our room was on the 15th floor=top floor and the view was AMAZING!! Out one of our floor to ceiling windows we could see the small row of lighted Christmas Trees that lit the path to THE TREE (note: you cannot see THE TREE, but the little Christmas trees leading to it are pretty also). Out the other window was a terrific view of St. Patrick's Cathedral which is breathtaking. There was chilled water on each floor, and the elevators were extremely fast. The room and bathroom were adequate in size, and we had plenty of closet space. The room was cleaned every day and spotless when we returned from our daily sight-seeing throughout the city. Upon check-in which was around 5pm on a Sunday, we were greeted by friendly employees and got checked-in quickly. The staff was always friendly and spoke everytime you saw them. The room temperature was very comfortable because we could control how hot/cold the room was ourself. There truly is nothing bad to say about this hotel. Our experience was wonderful, and when we go back to New York, we will DEFINITELY stay there again!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel/Couldn't Have Asked for Anything Better!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location at this boutique hotel cannot be beat. It's amazing. If you are a shopper, you less than 1 block from 5th Avenue and across from Rockerfeller Center. The room: My initial room was really small and facing a building. They immediately honored my request for a bigger room, which was a minimal $20 up-charge. This room was a nice size (for New York) and great view. The room wasn't extravagant; however, very comfortable, clean and had everything we needed! Each floor has complimentary water bottles, which was a great touch.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: i stayed there back in july,ideal spot close to everything,great bar next door jhonny utahs.hotel clean and comfortable no problems
reviews.title: 5 nites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Simple, modern, straight forward boutique hotel in fabulous mid-town location, across the street from the north promenade of Rockefeller Center and just down the block from Radio City Music Hall. You are literally just steps from two prominent eating establishments, Johnny Utah's and The Terrace. While there is no room service, per se, the hotel offers delivery service from local restaurants, delvered to the lobby, paid by the staff and added to your bill.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: It was clean, funky and offerred many amenities.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - Couldn't of been happier!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stopped at this smart boutique style hotel from Monday December 5th until Sunday December 11th. We wanted a place as close to the famous "Christmas Tree" as we could get due to my knee injury. Well I believe in telling it as I see it so here goes, this hotel was fantastic. Smart, modern and with just the right amount of "staff help" as you might need, it made this feel mre like your ouw little apartment than a bulk standard room. Very clean and with more than enough mod cons for us to make a good old cup of tea every day after our adventures in this amazing city. The staff were excellent and always threaded us with swift service and a smile, acces to the living room, computer equipment including printer and a really nice coffee machine all came in the price which was brilliant. There was also a small gym and use of a washing machine and tumble dryer which after a day outin the rain was warmly welcomed. In all honesty if you are after somewhere clean, tidy and so close to the major attractions that you can almost touch them at a really good price then look no further. Thank you for an amazing 1st stay in a wonderful city, you made this trip so worth while, we will be back for sure. I promise you that a stay at this excellent hotel will not break the bank or ruin your visit, in fact it will take away the worry of finding somewhere suitable for all ages, you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: A little known jewel in itself....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I went to NYC for our honeymoon and stayed here. It would have been decent had it not been for the rude staff and manager. We had to pay for a night we couldn't be there because New York completely shut down all incoming flights. We told them we would stay an extra night to make up for not being there, but we did not want to pay for a night we weren't there. This was especially the case, since we had to pay for a night in Chicago, and their concierge informed us that they were not booked the night we missed. After talking with the manager, the concierge then told me that they were booked and denied ever telling me different. She also yelled at me and refused to let me speak with the manager. Once I made contact with the manager, he was equally useless, and basically told me to screw off. Glad I spent 7 nights worth of money there...for my honeymoon. Also the rooms were rather small, a/c didn't work, and there are zero ammenities. Don't go to NYC, people are rude.
reviews.title: Rude & Unaccommodating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Jewel, sight unseen, based on reviews on Hotels.com and Trip Advisor. It was everything I had hoped for. The Jewel provides a good clean room with a refrigerator and a simple bathroom -- nicely stylish digs, typical boutique hotel design, very limited amenities. You do have access to the Terrace Club next door for discounted meals and drinks. However, the location of this hotel is superb as the front door opened directly onto 51st street with a view of the Christmas Tree at Rockefeller. December hotel prices in New York can easily climb to $500 plus/night for what is normally a $350/night room...but we booked the Jewel for only $319/night on hotels.com. I was actually hesitant to recommend the hotel because I was afraid it will become too busy and raise its prices!
reviews.title: Fabulous location and fantastic price for the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a 2 bed-room apartment for the 4 of us during our stay. Location was perfect. Bedrooms and living room a bit small but that was to be expected. There were 2 bathrooms which was a happy surprise. Clean linens and room service did not stinge on bath towels (we had 4 fresh towels per day per bathroom). Air con wasn't working properly but we were able to get someone to fix it even in the middle of the night. Front desk was polite and efficient, so different from the other New York hotels. There was a brand new washing machine and dryer on the 5th floor which we used couple of times. The machines were brand new and guests could use them free of charge.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is on a street wich is not that busy with noisy trafic. We arrived very early in the morning and they provided us with a room anyway. As this was next to the airco installations, we asked for a new one, wich they had ready for us at 13.00. The staff was very friendly and helpfull, the rooms clean and comfortable. The subway is close, the MOMA and Central Park are at walking distance.
reviews.title: nice hotel, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Right in the center of Manhattan, this Boutique Hotel has everything you could need or ask for on a visit to New York City. Clean, tidy, modern and minimalist at a very reasonable price.The rooms are small but well laid out and very modern. The service was excellent. You are a 5 / 10 minute walk away from everything - Central Park, Broadway, major shopping etc. Radio City is just a minute walk away as is Rockefeller Center. If we were to be hyper-critical, our only negative observation would be that we wished the water pressure in the bathrooms was a little stronger and that the washroom had a more efficient ventilation system. but that did not detract from our overall stay and we would have no hesitation staying at the Jewel on our next visit.
reviews.title: A Real Jewel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: When they call this the jewel they are not kidding. If you are looking for a fancy uppity hotel this is not for you. If you are looking for a clean, modern, safe hotel close to everything this is for you!!! They do not have valet parking or breakfast but who wants to eat in a hotel when you are in NY. I was so impressed when checking in. The lobby is SMALL but clean and new. Very friendly staff members. Room was on the small side but who is staying in the room in NY? VERY clean, new and up to date. I will be staying here again. Parking garage is just a few blocks up the street. Everything is within walking distance. The rock is right in front of the hotel, you can see the tree and 30 rock. The today show is 100 yards away from the hotel. Time square is close, the subway is close, and it is just a GEM!!!
reviews.title: Hidden Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 5 days at the Jewel over Christmas. When people say "Location is everything" then this hotel has "everything". Check-in was speedy with friendly, helpful assistants. The room was modern, clean, and comfortable. Our room was on the 9th floor and looking out the window; to the left, there's St Patricks Cathedral 1/2 block away; to the right, there's Radio City Music Hall 1/2 block away; Rockefeller Center?, just walk across the street and you're there. A nice touch to the room was the motion sensing night light at the foot of the bed (made the middle of the night foray to the bathroom convenient), and the free bottled water (new bottles that you refill as much as you like) were the icing on the cake. This will be our Number 1 hotel any time we travel to NYC.
reviews.title: One of the Better Hotels in NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Compliments to the staff of The Jewel. We were a 5 minute walk to Radio City Music Hall and a minute or two walk to the great (Christmas Tree) and all the surrounding Rockefeller Center Holiday activities. Within walking distance to 5th Ave stores and is the ideal place to be for Christmas for sure and probably all other seasons as well. The young ladies handling check in and out acted more like owners than employees.
reviews.title: Compliments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Looking forwared to returning.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Ideal Location.

aka: The Jewel Facing Rockefeller Hotel New York City
description: Property Description: The Jewel Facing Rockefeller Center is a full service hotel with 135 rooms located opposite Rockefeller Center, steps away from the famous skating rink, Christmas tree, St. Patrick’s Cathedral, Saks Fifth Avenue, Museum of Modern Art and Radio City Music Hall. Minutes from world class shopping, restaurants and entertainment. The Jewel Facing Rockefeller Center is the best value hotel based on quality and the prime location. The Jewel Facing Rockefeller Center provides:• Safe, restricted entry• Instant registration and check out• Free high speed internet access throughout the hotel• Nearby restaurant • Multi-menu in room dining options (through onsite restaurant and many local restaurants)• Refrigerator and microwave available• Unlimited complimentary chilled purified bottled water • 3 meeting and event rooms available nearby (maximum reception style 55 people)• Free use of computer/printer • Ergonomic workstations• State of the art guest rooms with premium bedding• Contemporary furnishings• Flat panel HD TVs• Complimentary coffee and tea• 24 hour guest service desk • Fitness room • Exercise equipment delivered to guest room upon request • Value rates
